channel.title: Comments on: Connect Dynamics NAV table with an External SQL Database

item.title: By: Muhammad Arif
item.dc:creator: Muhammad Arif
item.description: Great work, I have one query i am trying to display message on InsertRecord trigger its work fine when i insert record from nav but when i insert record from SQLServer the message could not display i think when we insert record from SQLServer then its trigger not fired. Any soluction ?
item.content:encoded:
Great work,
I have one query i am trying to display message on InsertRecord trigger its work fine when i insert record from nav but when i insert record from SQLServer the message could not display i think when we insert record from SQLServer then its trigger not fired.
Any soluction ?

item.title: By: Cabanos
item.dc:creator: Cabanos
item.description: Hi, What kind of rights user must have for SQL database? Control, Delete, Insert...?
item.content:encoded:
Hi,
What kind of rights user must have for SQL database? Control, Delete, Insert…?

item.title: By: CNowak
item.dc:creator: CNowak
item.description:
Hi Jaspreet, I want to connect to a transfer database with a given tablestructure. There are fields in then table with datatype „float“. When i do a read on this table i get the error:
Table.Setrange(…); Tabel.FINDFIRST(); -> Error: ... Table content in the IORH_ORDER_HEADER table on SQL Server contains a value that is not compatible with the corresponding data type that is defined for the table.
Field: IORH_WEIGHT Type: Decimal SQL type: float
The table design may have been changed outside Microsoft Dynamics NAV. …
Any idea, how to handle this?
item.content:encoded:
Hi Jaspreet,
I want to connect to a transfer database with a given tablestructure.
There are fields in then table with datatype „float“.
When i do a read on this table i get the error:

Table.Setrange(…);
Tabel.FINDFIRST(); -> Error:
…
Table content in the IORH_ORDER_HEADER table on SQL Server contains a value that is not compatible with the corresponding data type that is defined for the table.

Field: IORH_WEIGHT
Type: Decimal
SQL type: float

The table design may have been changed outside Microsoft Dynamics NAV.
…

Any idea, how to handle this?

item.title: By: jaspreet
item.dc:creator: jaspreet
item.description:
Hi Mads, I did pass username and password in my Database connection string and it was a externally hosted SQL server. So I can confirm to you that it is using the username and password specified in the connection string.
You can try to get a free sql server from https://appharbor.com/addons/sqlserver to test this functionality. It was fairly straightforward.
item.content:encoded:
Hi Mads,
I did pass username and password in my Database connection string and it was a externally hosted SQL server.
So I can confirm to you that it is using the username and password specified in the connection string.

You can try to get a free sql server from https://appharbor.com/addons/sqlserver to test this functionality. It was fairly straightforward.

item.title: By: Mads Morre
item.dc:creator: Mads Morre
item.description:
Hi Jaspreet Just found this Blog I’m trying to connect to an external SQL via these functionality, but I get an error, saying that I haven’t got the permissions.
When I read this discussion on MIBUSO then “https://forum.mibuso.com/discussion/67072/connecting-nav-2016-to-an-external-sql-database” it seems that the system uses the NAV Service User iD and not the one specified in the parameter. How did you solve that? Regards Mads Morre
item.content:encoded:
Hi Jaspreet
Just found this Blog
I’m trying to connect to an external SQL via these functionality, but I get an error, saying that I haven’t got the permissions.

When I read this discussion on MIBUSO then “https://forum.mibuso.com/discussion/67072/connecting-nav-2016-to-an-external-sql-database” it seems that the system uses the NAV Service User iD and not the one specified in the parameter.
How did you solve that?
Regards
Mads Morre

item.title: By: jaspreet
item.dc:creator: jaspreet
item.description:
You mean ExternalName Property of the table? You would like to take customers from different companies in NAV and sync them to separate tables in the External DB?
As far as I know , ExternalName cannot be set using C/AL. You can write logic to register different database connection depending upon the current company although I don't think it helps with your requirement.
item.content:encoded:
You mean ExternalName Property of the table? You would like to take customers from different companies in NAV and sync them to separate tables in the External DB?

As far as I know , ExternalName cannot be set using C/AL.
You can write logic to register different database connection depending upon the current company although I don’t think it helps with your requirement.

item.title: By: Joao
item.dc:creator: Joao
item.description: How would you dynamically change property ExternalName using C/AL, to rely on the same structure at a time on different external connections, but access similar structured, but distinct, external tables? e.g. the Customer table in different companies and tenants?
item.content:encoded: How would you dynamically change property ExternalName using C/AL, to rely on the same structure at a time on different external connections, but access similar structured, but distinct, external tables? e.g. the Customer table in different companies and tenants?

item.title: By: Joao
item.dc:creator: Joao
item.description:
Great article, Jaspreet!
How about if you want to use the same table structure, say table RemoteCustomer to connect at different times to different NAV company Customer tables? Imagine this in multi-tenancy NAV.
How can one programmatically change the ExternalName property, and say e.g. ExternalName=Company1$Customer or ExternalName=Company2$Customer or ExternalName=Company3$Customer
item.content:encoded:
Great article, Jaspreet!

How about if you want to use the same table structure, say table RemoteCustomer to connect at different times to different NAV company Customer tables? Imagine this in multi-tenancy NAV.

How can one programmatically change the ExternalName property, and say e.g. ExternalName=Company1$Customer or ExternalName=Company2$Customer or ExternalName=Company3$Customer
